Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani was greeted with a standing ovation before his first at-bat.
Ohtani hit a line drive down the right-field line and reached third base, prompting 'MVP' chants from the crowd.
The Dodgers won the game in 10 innings with a score of 6-2.
In the top of the 10th inning, the Angels intentionally walked Ohtani, and Mookie Betts hit a home run on the first pitch from reliever Roansy Contreras.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani expressed that playing in front of the Anaheim crowd again was a special moment.
Angels manager Ron Washington commented on the decision to intentionally walk Ohtani, expressing respect for Mookie Betts and hoping for a ground ball from Contreras.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The video board operator at Angel Stadium displayed 'Used to work here' under Ohtani's name during the fifth inning.
Ohtani's return marked exactly one year since his last game in an Angels uniform.
